body_html:
@soloice suggestion worked for me:

I downloaded nightly build to my hard disk and pip install --upgrade C:\tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0rc2-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl works for me.

Although on first run I encountered an error:
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified: 'C:\\ProgramData\\Anaconda3\\envs\\tensorflow\\lib\\site-packages\\setuptools-27.2.0-py3.5.egg'

But just deactivating and reactivating the conda env, then reissuing the command seemed to resolve the issue.
body_text:
@soloice suggestion worked for me:

I downloaded nightly build to my hard disk and pip install --upgrade C:\tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0rc2-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl works for me.

Although on first run I encountered an error:
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified: 'C:\\ProgramData\\Anaconda3\\envs\\tensorflow\\lib\\site-packages\\setuptools-27.2.0-py3.5.egg'
But just deactivating and reactivating the conda env, then reissuing the command seemed to resolve the issue.
body:
@soloice suggestion worked for me:

> I downloaded nightly build to my hard disk and pip install --upgrade C:\tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0rc2-cp35-cp35m-win_amd64.whl works for me.

Although on first run I encountered an error:
`FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified: 'C:\\ProgramData\\Anaconda3\\envs\\tensorflow\\lib\\site-packages\\setuptools-27.2.0-py3.5.egg'`

But just deactivating and reactivating the conda env, then reissuing the command seemed to resolve the issue.
